Posts.Content: My mistake I mean it has been 2 months.
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: When they find a lump in your breasts you have the right to overact and also its o.k. to make your own health decisions, Doctors have occasionally been wrong, so for your own peace of mind do what you think needs to be done!!
Posts.Title: Mammography results "benign"?

Posts.Content: My recovery time was a few days and I still am alittle tender, but I don't think you are having the same kind of biopsy that I had. I had a wire guided biopsy where I had to go have two wires inserted first so they knew where the tissue was that needed to come out. Good luck and let me know how it goes!! Even mine was know big deal , except waiting for the results which were good!!
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: Sorry, Yes I was completely asleep for the surgery
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: Hello again, I had a wire guided biopsy in Jan. which went fine, but I think my surgeon might have left alittle bit of the wire in the breast, I can see two little black spots, that I thought would go away, does anyone know if this is some sort of marker in case there had been something wrong where he would have to go back in?
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: Hello again, I had a wire guided biopsy in Jan. which went fine, but I think my surgeon might have left alittle bit of the wire in the breast, I can see two little black spots, (that I thought would go away,) does anyone know if this is some sort of marker in case there had been something wrong where he would have to go back in?
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: I had a wire guided excisional biopsy on the 23 of Jan. and for me they had to do that type of biopsy because of where the microcalcifications were located, they were pretty close to the chest wall, and also I think it depends on their size.
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: Thank you, but could it still be the dye after a month?
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: Thank you, that is good to know!
Posts.Title: Needle Localization/biopsy 1 2 3

Posts.Content: Has anyone had an excisional biopsy?And if so, how long was your breast tender after the biopsy? I had a biopsy on the 23rd of Jan. and it is still pretty tender. Thanks
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy info needed

Posts.Content: Thank you, It's been three weeks today and I am still alittle tender and get shooting pains occasionally, but there is no redness or heat so I am not to worried, they had to go very deep into the breast so I think that is why it is still tender, if it keeps up I will certainly be calling my surgeon!! Thanks
Posts.Title: excisional biopsy info needed

Posts.Content: I recently had a biopsy for microcalcifications on the 23 of jan. and there was nothing to it! The hardest part was holding still while they developed the films for the wire guides. But believe me I know your anxiety!! And thank God I recieved great results on the 25th. Try not to panic to much, I know it is easier said than done. I had approximately 7 in one group and it turned out to be nothing!! So good luck
Posts.Title: Core biopsy 1 2

Posts.Content: I had at least 7 calcifications in one area that is why they needed to do a biopsy. Back at the beginning of summer they saw the first ones and then 6 months later there were more so they (and I )wanted to be sure it was nothing to worry about. I go back tomorrow to have the stitches removed, I also am 49, they said they are very common in women of my age group.
Posts.Title: Core biopsy 1 2

Posts.Content: That is wonderful news!! Now you can relax and get on with life!
Posts.Title: Core biopsy 1 2
